meanings.sent1: She quaffed the refreshing lemonade on a hot summer day.
meanings.sent2: He quaffed the entire glass of milk in one gulp.
meanings.sent3: The little girl quaffed her juice so quickly that she got a brain freeze.
meanings.sent4: The travelers quaffed from the fountain of youth, feeling invigorated.
meanings.sent5: The knight quaffed from the enchanted goblet, gaining strength for the battle ahead.

meanings.definition: To consume (a beverage) in large quantities
meanings.sent1: During the party, they quaffed multiple bottles of soda.
meanings.sent2: The group of friends quaffed all the beer at the pub in no time.
meanings.sent3: The marathon runners quaffed energy drinks to keep going during the race.
meanings.sent4: The crowd quaffed the cheers of victory after their team won the championship.
meanings.sent5: The workers quaffed coffee to stay awake during the night shift.
